thread.title: Potato Minestrone
thread.title_full: Potato Minestrone Recipe | Taste of Home

author: tasteofhome.com
title: Potato Minestrone
text:
Let the aroma of this savory soup waft through your home while you get ready for the holidays. I only have to slice some bread and prepare a salad to have dinner ready. For a thicker soup, mash half of the garbanzo beans before adding them to the slow cooker. â€”Paula Zsiray, Logan, Utah Featured In: 51 Cozy Slow Cooker Soups Prep: 10 min. Cook: 8-1/2 hours MAKES: 12 servings Prep: 10 min. Cook: 8-1/2 hours MAKES: 12 2 cans (14-1/2 ounces each) chicken or vegetable broth 1 can (28 ounces) crushed tomatoes 1 can (16 ounces) kidney beans, rinsed and drained 1 can (15 ounces) chickpeas, rinsed and drained 1 can (14-1/2 ounces) beef broth 2 cups frozen cubed hash brown potatoes, thawed 1 tablespoon dried minced onion 1 tablespoon dried parsley flakes 1 teaspoon salt 1 teaspoon dried oregano 1/2 teaspoon garlic powder 1/2 teaspoon dried basil 1/2 teaspoon dried marjoram 1 package (10 ounces) frozen chopped spinach, thawed and drained 2 cups frozen peas and carrots, thawed 1 cup: 125 calories, 1g fat (0 saturated fat), 2mg cholesterol, 916mg sodium, 23g carbohydrate (5g sugars, 6g fiber), 8g protein.
Directions In a 5-qt. slow cooker, combine the first 13 ingredients. Cover and cook on low for 8 hours. Stir in spinach and the peas and carrots; cook 30 minutes or until heated through. Yield: 12 servings (about 3 quarts).
